author: DarwinJS
body:
I tried hard to find this information in this repository :(

I know that Get-PackageProvider on PowerShell 6 and 7 show that the *provider* is version 3.x.x.x and I hope, but hate to assume, this also means it can talk to NuGet Server API version 3.

Can someone please clarify if NuGet Server API V3 is fully supported by PowerShell 6 & 7?

/cc @TravisEz13 @SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
This is more of a question for https://github.com/OneGet/oneget. I don't believe the work to support Nuget v3 was complete for the Nuget provider in PackageManagement. v3 is expected to be supported with PowerShellGetv3.
GitHub
OneGet/oneget
PackageManagement (aka OneGet) is a package manager for Windows - OneGet/oneget

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body:
Thanks for the pointer. Looks like it does indeed support the server api V3: https://github.com/OneGet/NuGetProvider/blob/master/releasenotes.md
GitHub
OneGet/NuGetProvider
NuGet Provider for OneGet. Works on Nano Server. Contribute to OneGet/NuGetProvider development by creating an account on GitHub.

title: What Version of the Nuget Server API is Required by PowerShell 6 and 7
